page.title: 01UPLAND, SOUTH OF KILMARNOCK
page.content: This rural landscape lies on higher land to the south of the Irvine Valley in North Ayrshire. This agriculatural area is mainly pastoral but ranges from unimproved rough grazing, to the north, to improved pasture/arable land further south. This is an area of primary industry with quarrying of basalt having been carried out in several places. There are several small derelict quarries and one large one in current production. Map evidence suggests a long history of settlement in this area and the present-day pattern is low density and mainly dispersed with over thirty isolated farms and cottages.
